output: A full description of the model specification can be found in the report by Subtask B of FC+COGEN-SIM with the title 'Specifications for Modelling Fuel Cell and Combustion-Based Residential Cogeneration Device within Whole-Building Simulation Programs'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the Annex 42 Fuel Cell model characterized?
output: The Annex 42 Fuel Cell model is characterized as a 'grey box' empirical model where a mixture of thermodynamic principles and empirical performance maps are used to model the cogeneration performance of a fairly complex device with many individual subsystems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How are the individual subsystems in EnergyPlus separated?
output: In EnergyPlus the individual subsystems are separated into individual input objects such as Generator:FuelCell:PowerModule or Generator:FuelCell:ExhaustGasToWaterHeatExchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the main energy balance equation for the fuel cell power module?
output: The main energy balance for the fuel cell power module (including the fuel reformation and fuel cell stacks) is given by the equation: \n\\beginequation  \\beginarrayl   \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dot N_i \\cdot \\left[ \\hat h_i - \\Delta_f\\hat h_i^o \\right] \\right)_fuel + \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dot N_i \\cdot \\left[ \\hat h_i - \\Delta_f\\hat h_i^o \\right] \\right)_air + \\dot N_liq - water \\cdot \\left( \\left[ \\hat h - \\Delta_f\\hat h^o \\right]_H_2Oliq - \\Delta_f\\hat h_H_2Ofg^o \\right) \\\\   \\quad \\quad + \\dot H_dilution - air - in + \\dot N_fuel \\cdot LHV_fuel + P_elancillaries - AC \\\\   = P_el + \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dot N_i \\cdot \\left[ \\ddot h_i - \\Delta_f\\hat h_i^o \\right] \\right)_FCPM - cg + q_s - cool + q_skin - loss + \\dot H_dilution - air - out  \\endarray \\endequation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What do the remaining equations describe?
output: The remaining equations describe various terms and the balance of systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the electrical efficiency modeled?
output: The electrical efficiency is modeled using the equation: \n\\beginequation \\varepsilon_el = \\left[ \\varepsilon_0 + \\varepsilon_1 \\cdot P_el + \\varepsilon_2 \\cdot P_el^2 \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 - N_stops \\cdot D \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 - (MAX(\\int\\limits_ dt - t_threshold0.0)) \\cdot L \\right] \\endequation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for the blower power?
output: The equation for the blower power is given by: \n\\beginequation P_blower - el = b_0 + b_1 \\cdot \\dot N_air + b_2 \\cdot \\dot N_air^2 + b_3 \\cdot \\dot N_air^3 \\endequation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What options does the model offer regarding process air flow rate?
output: The model is formulated to offer different options for describing the flow rate of process air either as a function of electrical power produced or the fuel flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is one of the equations for the process air flow rate?
output: One of the equations for the process air flow rate is: \n\\beginequation \\dot N_air = \\left[ a_0 + a_1 \\cdot P_el + a_2 \\cdot P_el^2 \\right].\\left[ 1 + a_3 \\cdot T_air \\right] \\endequation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is summarized in the text regarding model equations?
output: The text provides a summary of the relevant model equations which are taken from the Annex 42 model specification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is the first equation described in the text?
output: The first equation is the main energy balance for the fuel cell power module which includes the fuel reformation and fuel cell stacks.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is the purpose of the energy balance equation in the context?
output: This energy balance is used to model the enthalpy of the product gases that leave the fuel cell power module.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the main energy balance equation for the fuel cell power module?
output: The equation is: \\( \\beginarrayl \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dotN_i \\cdot \\left[ \\hath_i - \\Delta_f \\hath_i^o \\right] \\right)_fuel + \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dotN_i \\cdot \\left[ \\hath_i - \\Delta_f \\hath_i^o \\right] \\right)_air + \\dotN_liq - water \\cdot \\left( \\left[ \\hath - \\Delta_f \\hath^o \\right]_H_2Oliq - \\Delta_f \\hath_H_2Ofg^o \\right) + \\dotH_dilution - air - in + \\dotN_fuel \\cdot LHV_fuel + P_elancillaries - AC = P_el + \\sum\\limits_i \\left( \\dotN_i \\cdot \\left[ \\ddoth_i - \\Delta_f \\hath_i^o \\right] \\right)_FCPM - cg + q_s - cool + q_skin - loss + \\dotH_dilution - air - out \\endarray \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What do the remaining equations describe?
output: The remaining equations describe various terms and the balance of systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the electrical efficiency modeled?
output: The electrical efficiency is modeled using the equation: \\( \\varepsilon_el = \\left[ \\varepsilon_0 + \\varepsilon_1 \\cdot P_el + \\varepsilon_2 \\cdot P_el^2 \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 - N_stops \\cdot D \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 - (\\max(\\int dt - t_threshold0.0)) \\cdot L \\right] \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for blower electrical power?
output: The equation for blower electrical power is: \\( P_blower - el = b_0 + b_1 \\cdot \\dotN_air + b_2 \\cdot \\dotN_air^2 + b_3 \\cdot \\dotN_air^3 \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What options does the model offer in several places?
output: In several places the model is formulated to offer different options such as describing the flow rate of process air either as a function of electrical power produced or the fuel flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for air flow rate as a function of electrical power?
output: The equation for air flow rate as a function of electrical power is: \\( \\dotN_air = \\left[ a_0 + a_1 \\cdot P_el + a_2 \\cdot P_el^2 \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 + a_3 \\cdot T_air \\right] \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for air flow rate as a function of fuel flow rate?
output: The equation for air flow rate as a function of fuel flow rate is: \\( \\dotN_air = \\left[ a_0 + a_1 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel + a_2 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel^2 \\right] \\cdot \\left[ 1 + a_3 \\cdot T_air \\right] \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for liquid water flow rate?
output: The equation for liquid water flow rate is: \\( \\dotN_liq - water = w_0 + w_1 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel + w_2 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel^2 \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for pump electrical power?
output: The equation for pump electrical power is: \\( P_pump - el = p_0 + p_1 \\cdot \\dotN_water + p_2 \\cdot \\dotN_water^2 + p_3 \\cdot \\dotN_water^3 \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for compressor electrical power?
output: The equation for compressor electrical power is: \\( P_comp - el = c_0 + c_1 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel + c_2 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel^2 + c_3 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel^3 \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for ancillary electrical power?
output: The equation for ancillary electrical power is: \\( P_elancillaries - AC = anc_0 + anc_1 \\cdot \\dotN_fuel \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is the purpose of the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus?
output: The wind turbine (object Generator:WindTurbine) model is intended to estimate the production of electric power of both horizontal and vertical axis wind turbine systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: Why is the performance of wind turbine systems highly dependent on local wind conditions?
output: Due to the cubic relationship between the wind speed and the power produced by a wind turbine the performance of these systems is highly dependent on local wind conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What differences typically appear in wind turbine simulations?
output: Differences between typical meteorological year (TMY) wind data attached to the simulation and local wind data at the site where wind turbine system is installed typically appear.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the wind turbine model estimate?
output: The model estimates the air density and wind speed at the particular height of the system and factors differences between the wind speed from the TMY weather data and the local wind speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What should be included in the wind turbine simulation?
output: The weather data file should thus be included in the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What inputs does the wind turbine model require?
output: The model also requires inputs of both an annual average wind speed that represents accurate wind profile at the location and the height where this annual average wind speed was determined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How does the model calculate the power production for wind turbines?
output: The model calculates the power production by both horizontal axis wind turbines (HAWT) and vertical axis wind turbines (VAWT) from generic mathematical equations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: Who are the authors of the 2007 report on modeling fuel cell cogeneration devices?
output: Beausoleil-Morrison I. A. Weber F. Marechal and B. Griffith.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is the title of the report edited by I. Beausoleil-Morrison and N. Kelly?
output: Specifications for Modelling Fuel Cell and Combustion-Based Residential Cogeneration Device within Whole-Building Simulation Programs.

input: Which organization released the Chemistry WebBook in March 2003?
output: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

input: What is the NASA report number for the computer program for calculation of complex chemical equilibrium?
output: NASA SP-273.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What is the purpose of the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus?
output: To estimate the production of electric power of both horizontal and vertical axis wind turbine systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: Why is the performance of wind turbine systems highly dependent on local wind conditions?
output: Due to the cubic relationship between the wind speed and the power produced by a wind turbine.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What differences typically appear in wind data for wind turbine systems?
output: Differences between typical meteorological year (TMY) wind data and local wind data at the site.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What does the model estimate for wind turbine systems?
output: The air density and wind speed at the particular height of the system and factors differences between the wind speed from the TMY weather data and the local wind speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What should be included in the simulation for wind turbine modeling?
output: The weather data file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What inputs are required for the wind turbine model?
output: An annual average wind speed that represents accurate wind profile at the location and the height where this annual average wind speed was determined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: How does the model calculate power production for wind turbines?
output: From generic mathematical equations for both horizontal axis wind turbines (HAWT) and vertical axis wind turbines (VAWT).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What control scheme is currently available in EnergyPlus for wind turbines?
output: A variable speed control scheme.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What assumptions does the model make about power generation at rated wind speed?
output: The model assumes constant power generation at the rated power and the rated wind speed when the ambient wind speed is between the rated wind speed and cut out wind speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: Why does the model not attempt to model various subsystems of the wind turbine system?
output: Due to computational convergence time and usability.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Wind Turbine -> text
input: What does the total system efficiency include for wind turbines?
output: Both conversion losses occurring during the DC-AC-DC conversion processes and delivery losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: How is the wind turbine modeled in EnergyPlus?
output: As a generation component that produces electricity and delivers it directly to buildings.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: When are wind turbine components executed in EnergyPlus?
output: At the beginning of each time step called by the HVAC manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What does the model calculate regarding electricity production?
output: Electricity production that both HAWTs and VAWTs produce from general mathematical equations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What does the electric load center determine in EnergyPlus?
output: The whole building electrical demand deducting the power output by wind turbine along with any power production by photovoltaic components from the total electrical demand requested in the building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Model Description -> text
input: What happens to excessive electricity production in EnergyPlus?
output: It is either sold or stored as the user specifies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Input and Data -> text
input: What must the user input for the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus?
output: The required information according to the IO Reference Manual (ref: Generator:WindTurbine).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Input and Data -> text
input: What does the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus require?
output: A unique identifying name and an availability schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Input and Data -> text
input: What must the schedule name refer to in the wind turbine model?
output: A valid schedule type (range 0-1) and contain values of fractional operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Input and Data -> text
input: What various inputs describe the wind turbine configuration?
output: Rotor type control type rotor diameter overall height and number of blades.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is the assumption made by the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus regarding power generation?
output: The model assumes constant power generation at the rated power and the rated wind speed when the ambient wind speed is between the rated wind speed and cut out wind speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus not attempt to model?
output: The model does not attempt to model various types of subsystems of the entire wind turbine system such as shafts generators and inverters due to computational convergence time and usability.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the total system efficiency include in the wind turbine model?
output: The total system efficiency includes both conversion losses occurring during the DC-AC-DC conversion processes and delivery losses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the wind turbine modeled in EnergyPlus?
output: The wind turbine is modeled as a generation component that produces electricity and delivers it directly to buildings.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: When are wind turbine components executed in the EnergyPlus model?
output: Wind turbine components are executed at the beginning of each time step called by the HVAC manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the model calculate regarding electricity production?
output: The model calculates electricity production that both HAWTs and VAWTs produce from general mathematical equations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What happens to excessive electricity production in the EnergyPlus model?
output: Excessive production of electricity greater than needed from wind turbine along with photovoltaic components is either sold or stored as the user specifies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What must the user input for the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus?
output: The user must input the required information according to the IO Reference Manual (ref: Generator:WindTurbine).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What information is required for the wind turbine model in EnergyPlus?
output: The wind turbine model in EnergyPlus requires a unique identifying name and an availability schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What do various inputs describe in the wind turbine configuration?
output: Various inputs describe wind turbine configuration such as rotor type control type rotor diameter overall height and number of blades.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What determines overall electricity production in the wind turbine model?
output: Rated data provided in the manufacturer's literature determines overall electricity production by using generic equations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What inputs define local wind conditions for the wind turbine model?
output: Two inputs such as annual local average wind speed and height for local average wind speed define local wind conditions at a specific location.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What additional inputs are required for VAWT systems in the wind turbine model?
output: Three additional inputs for VAWT systems are required: blade lift and drag coefficients corresponding to the maximum tip speed ratio and blade chord area.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the wind turbine model analyze given the inputs?
output: Given the inputs needed the wind turbine model analyzes local wind speed since wind speed is critical to determine the production of electricity of wind turbine systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How does the model minimize uncertainty involved with wind data?
output: To minimize uncertainty involved with wind data it factors differences between annual average wind speed from weather data and local annual average wind speed at the particular height of the local meteorological station.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What should the user attach to the simulation in the wind turbine model?
output: The user should attach a weather data to the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What determines overall electricity production in wind turbine systems according to the manufacturer's literature?
output: Data provided in the manufacturer's literature determines overall electricity production by using generic equations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What inputs are included for determining electricity production in wind turbine systems?
output: These inputs include rated power rated wind speed cut in wind speed cut out wind speed fraction system efficiency and maximum tip speed ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How are local wind conditions defined for a wind turbine model?
output: Two inputs such as annual local average wind speed and height for local average wind speed define local wind conditions at a specific location.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What additional inputs are required for HAWT systems?
output: HAWT systems need a maximum power coefficient and empirical power coefficient parameters C1 through C6.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the maximum power coefficient control in a wind turbine system?
output: The maximum power coefficient controls overall performance of the rotor which defines the power extraction efficiency from the ambient air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: When does the model predict power generation more accurately for a wind turbine?
output: The model predicts power generation more accurately when the user inputs the empirical power coefficients C1 through C6 for a specific wind turbine.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What additional inputs are required for VAWT systems?
output: Three additional inputs for VAWT system are required: blade lift and drag coefficients corresponding to the maximum tip speed ratio and blade chord area.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: Why is blade chord area requested in the VAWT system model?
output: Blade chord area is requested for calculating forces on a single blade.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the wind turbine model analyze given the necessary inputs?
output: Given the inputs needed the wind turbine model analyzes local wind speed since wind speed is critical to determine the production of electricity of wind turbine systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How does the model minimize uncertainty with wind data?
output: To minimize uncertainty involved with wind data it factors differences between annual average wind speed from weather data and local annual average wind speed at the particular height of the local meteorological station.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What should the user attach to the simulation for accurate wind speed data?
output: The user should attach a weather data to the simulation (for a design day simulation the wind speed data from the design day description is used).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What equation is used to convert annual average wind speed into a local wind speed at the height input by the user?
output: V_LocalTMY = V_AnnualAvg \\left( \\frac\\delta_metH_met \\right)^a_met \\left( \\fracH\\delta \\right)^a

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the wind speed factor Fv calculated?
output: F_V = \\fracV_LocalTMYV_Local

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What value is assigned to the wind speed factor Fv if no local wind conditions are input or no weather data file is attached?
output: The wind speed factor Fv of 1.0 is assigned if the user does not input the local wind conditions or the weather data file is not attached to the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How can the local air density be obtained?
output: The local air density can be obtained by using EnergyPlus psychrometric functions as follows: T_Local = OutDryBulbTempAt(Z)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What equation is used to determine the local barometric pressure?
output: P_Local = OutBaroPressAt(Z)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local humidity ratio calculated?
output: \\omega_Local = PsyWFnTdbTwbPb(T_LocalT_wbP_Local)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What equation is used to determine the local air density?
output: \\rho_Local = PsyRhoAirFnPbTdbW(P_LocalT_Local\\omega_initial)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is TMY wind speed converted into wind speed at the specific height of the wind turbine rotor?
output: V_Z = WindSpeedAt(Z)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local wind speed at the rotor height calculated?
output: V_Local = \\fracV_ZF_v

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What equation is used to obtain the tip speed ratio (TSR)?
output: \\lambda = \\frac\\omega RV_Local

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine -> text
input: How does the model calculate electrical power for HAWT systems?
output: Once the local wind speed and air density are determined the model calculates electrical power produced by a wind turbine system according to the rotor type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine -> text
input: What approximation does the model use for HAWT systems when all six empirical coefficient parameters are input?
output: The model uses an analytical approximation when the user inputs all six empirical coefficient parameters C1 through C6.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the local wind speed at the height where the local annual average wind speed is measured factored?
output: The local wind speed at the height where the local annual average wind speed is measured is factored using the equation: \\( V_LocalTMY = V_AnnualAvg\\left( \\frac\\delta_metH_met \\right)^a_met\\left( \\fracH\\delta  \\right)^a \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the local TMY wind speed?
output: \\( V_LocalTMY = V_AnnualAvg\\left( \\frac\\delta_metH_met \\right)^a_met\\left( \\fracH\\delta  \\right)^a \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the wind speed factor \\(F_V\\) calculated?
output: \\( F_V = \\fracV_LocalTMYV_Local \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What happens if the user does not input local wind conditions or the weather data file is not attached?
output: If the user does not input local wind conditions or the weather data file is not attached a wind speed factor \\(F_v\\) of 1.0 is assigned.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How can local air density be obtained in EnergyPlus?
output: The local air density can be obtained using EnergyPlus psychrometric functions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local temperature \\(T_Local\\) determined?
output: \\( T_Local = \\textOutDryBulbTempAt(Z) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local pressure \\(P_Local\\) determined?
output: \\( P_Local = \\textOutBaroPressAt(Z) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local humidity ratio \\(\\omega_Local\\) determined?
output: \\( \\omega_Local = \\textPsyWFnTdbTwbPb(T_LocalT_wbP_Local) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: How is the local air density \\(\\rho_Local\\) calculated?
output: \\( \\rho_Local = \\textPsyRhoAirFnPbTdbW(P_LocalT_Local\\omega_initial) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the TMY wind speed converted to the wind speed at the specific height of the wind turbine rotor?
output: The TMY wind speed is converted to the wind speed at the specific height of the wind turbine rotor using the EnergyPlus function: \\( V_Z = \\textWindSpeedAt(Z) \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the formula for \\(V_Z\\)?
output: \\( V_Z = \\textWindSpeedAt(Z) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the local wind speed at the rotor height \\(V_Local\\) calculated?
output: The local wind speed at the rotor height \\(V_Local\\) is calculated using the equation: \\( V_Local = \\fracV_ZF_v \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for calculating the local wind speed \\(V_Local\\) at the rotor height?
output: \\( V_Local = \\fracV_ZF_v \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How can the tip speed ratio (TSR) be obtained?
output: The tip speed ratio (TSR) can be obtained using the equation: \\( \\lambda = \\frac\\omega RV_Local \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the formula for the tip speed ratio \\(\\lambda\\)?
output: \\( \\lambda = \\frac\\omega RV_Local \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What does the model calculate once the local wind speed and air density are determined?
output: Once the local wind speed and air density are determined the model calculates the electrical power produced by a wind turbine system according to the rotor type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What approximations are available for HAWT systems?
output: For HAWT systems two different approximations are available: an analytical approximation when the user inputs all six empirical coefficient parameters \\(C_1\\) through \\(C_6\\) and a simple approximation if any of the empirical power coefficient parameters is not input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What equations define the analytical approximation for HAWT systems?
output: The equations that define the analytical approximation for HAWT systems are: \\( C_p = C_1(\\fracC_2\\lambda_i - C_3\\theta - C_4\\theta ^x - C_5)e^ - \\fracC_6(\\lambda \\theta )\\lambda_i \\) and \\( \\frac1\\lambda_i = \\frac1\\lambda + 0.08\\theta  - \\frac0.035\\theta ^3 + 1 \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for the power coefficient \\(C_p\\) in the analytical approximation?
output: \\( C_p = C_1(\\fracC_2\\lambda_i - C_3\\theta - C_4\\theta ^x - C_5)e^ - \\fracC_6(\\lambda \\theta )\\lambda_i \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for \\(\\frac1\\lambda_i\\) in the analytical approximation?
output: \\( \\frac1\\lambda_i = \\frac1\\lambda + 0.08\\theta  - \\frac0.035\\theta ^3 + 1 \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What is allowed by the model regarding rotor speed and power coefficient?
output: The model allows changing the rotor speed to meet the maximum tip speed ratio at each time step and the power coefficient calculated is set to the maximum if the calculated is greater than the maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: How is the power production of the wind turbine obtained assuming maximum rotor angle?
output: Assuming a maximum rotor angle of zero the power production of the wind turbine is obtained by the equation: \\( P_W = \\frac12\\rho_LocalA_RV__Local^3C_p(\\lambda \\theta ) \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation
input: What is the equation for power production \\(P_W\\) of the wind turbine with maximum rotor angle?
output: \\( P_W = \\frac12\\rho_LocalA_RV__Local^3C_p(\\lambda \\theta ) \\)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
input: What assumption does the model make if any empirical power coefficient parameters are not input?
output: If any empirical power coefficient parameters are not input the model assumes a simple approximation for power production of the wind turbine.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text

output: In the simple approximation the power production of the wind turbine is directly obtained from the kinetic energy equation: \\( P_W = \\frac12\\rho_LocalA_RV__Local^3C_p\\max (\\lambda \\theta ) \\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text

output: If either the power production of the wind turbine or local wind speed is greater than the rated power or rated wind speed \\(P_W\\) is defined as the rated power output at the rated wind speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: None -> Section: Generators -> text
